## On version control

I won't introduce here the benefits of using a good version control system such as [Git](https://git-scm.com/)

![On the benefits of VCS](img/vc.jpg){width="45%"}

## Git with data

While Git is a wonderful tool for text files versioning (code, writings in markup formats), it doesn't work with data

Several open source tools—each with a different structure and functioning—extend Git capabilities to handle data: [Git LFS](https://git-lfs.com/), [git-annex](https://git-annex.branchable.com/), [lakeFS](https://lakefs.io/), and [Dolt](https://github.com/dolthub/dolt)

[DVC](https://dvc.org/) was built with scientists in mind

## Initialization

Git repo:

```{.bash}
git init
```

```
Initialized empty Git repository in dvc/.git/
```

DVC project:

```{.bash}
dvc init
```

```
Initialized DVC repository.

You can now commit the changes to git.

What's next?
------------
- Check out the documentation: <https://dvc.org/doc>
- Get help and share ideas: <https://dvc.org/chat>
- Star us on GitHub: <https://github.com/iterative/dvc>
```

:::{.note}

You will also see a note about usage analytics collection and info on how to opt out.

:::

## Commit system files

```{.bash}
git status
```

```
On branch main

No commits yet

Changes to be committed:
  (use "git rm --cached <file>..." to unstage)
	new file:   .dvc/.gitignore
	new file:   .dvc/config
	new file:   .dvcignore
```

DVC has already added these files to the index for us!

```{.bash}
git commit -m "Initialize DVC"
```

```
[main (root-commit) a32e0ed] Initialize DVC
 3 files changed, 6 insertions(+)
 create mode 100644 .dvc/.gitignore
 create mode 100644 .dvc/config
 create mode 100644 .dvcignore
```
